intro: Pseudopodospermum turcomanicum, commonly known as the Turkestan sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a perennial herb characterized by its sprawling growth habit and fleshy, succulent stems. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on leafless stalks. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with a fine layer of hair. Pseudopodospermum turcomanicum is adapted to arid environments, with features that help it conserve water and survive in sandy soils.
